alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 7:46PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BAND OF SHOWERS NORTH OF COLD WATER ADVANCING EAST TOWARD POCATELLO AND BLACKFOOT THROUGH 900 PM MDT... At 740 PM MST, an area of mixed precipitation was located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Taber to near Cold Water Rest Area. Movement was east at 40 mph. Temperatures along the Interstate 86 corridor west of Pocatello are warm enough to support mostly rain or melting snow. North of the American Falls and Pocatello, temperatures are cold enough to support snowfall. In this area, we may see a quick shot of accumulating snow of 0.5 to 1.0 inch through 900 PM MDT. Motorists traveling on rural highways north of American Falls and along Interstate 15 from Fort Hall to Blackfoot should be prepared for winter driving conditions. When encountering reduced visibilty and slick roads, it is always a good idea to slow down. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Blackfoot, American Falls, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Lake Walcott, Ririe Reservoir, Neeley, Chesterfield Reservoir, Goshen, American Falls Reservoir, northern Blackfoot Reservoir, Chubbuck, Ammon, Shelley, Aberdeen, Inkom, Firth and Arimo.
